Summary Seasoned engineer and researcher on search relevance with hands-on development experience; project lead with major contributions spanning on machine learning ranking, relevance features, result set blending, search result presentation and query suggestions at leading search companies; Ph.D. on information retrieval and natural language processing with exceptional publication record in SIGIR and WWW. Specialties:Web search relevance, information retrieval, natural language processing Summary Seasoned engineer and researcher on search relevance with hands-on development experience; project lead with major contributions spanning on machine learning ranking, relevance features, result set blending, search result presentation and query suggestions at leading search companies; Ph.D. on information retrieval and natural language processing with exceptional publication record in SIGIR and WWW. Specialties:Web search relevance, information retrieval, natural language processing Seasoned engineer and researcher on search relevance with hands-on development experience; project lead with major contributions spanning on machine learning ranking, relevance features, result set blending, search result presentation and query suggestions at leading search companies; Ph.D. on information retrieval and natural language processing with exceptional publication record in SIGIR and WWW. Specialties:Web search relevance, information retrieval, natural language processing Experience Staff Software Engineer / Engineering Manager Google January 2014  – Present (1 year 7 months) Boulder, CO I relocated to Colorado in 2014 to join my wife here. I'm now working on Google payments, tech leading and managing a team for automatic reconciliation of payments systems. Staff Software Engineer / Engineering Manager Google January 2010  –  December 2013  (4 years) Mountain View, CA I'm managing and tech leading the news quality team at Google. My team is responsible for headlines ranking for Google News and search ranking for news results in web search. Director of Search Relevance OneRiot September 2009  –  January 2010  (5 months) Building and managing the search relevance team for OneRiot, a real-time search engine which leverages social activities on the Web. 
 
During my short stay at OneRiot, I focused on laying down the foundations and roadmap for improving search relevance for the real-time web. 
 
1. Implementing new scoring scheme to improve the overall relevance for search results 
2. Laying down the framework for machine learning ranking functions 
3. Designing the query rewriting framework 
4. Improving user rank for social network activities 
5. Leading the efforts in standardizing editorial test for fresh results; designing and leading the implementation of editorial judging tools and query triage tools. Senior Relevance Scientist Yahoo! Inc. September 2007  –  September 2009  (2 years 1 month) Tech lead and researcher/engineer in core search relevance. Major contributions span on relevance features, machine learning ranking, search result blending and result presentation. 
 
1. Tech lead and main contributor for launching a new batch of text matching features to machine learning ranking functions for various markets; greatly improved the proximity of the search results. 
 
2. Lead and launched Yahoo answers and blogs machine learning ranking functions, and web search result blending in two major international markets; greatly improved user experience and search relevance. 
 
3. Search result presentation - launched static abstract strategy for specific categories of queries; query and document feature research for snippet ranking in summary generation. 
 
4. Co-inventor for 3 patents filed on search relevance. Experience Engineering Manager - Search Infrastructure Google June 2010  – Present (5 years 2 months) Mountain View, CA Managed the frontend infrastructure that supports all of Google Search. Responsible for teams across 5 offices, building infrastructure for a system with over 1000 engineers. Promoted an atmosphere that fosters innovation, technical excellence and take pride in mentoring successful team members. 
 
- Search Toolkit 
- Google Weblight: Started an effort to transcode search results landing pages in emerging markets, where Search was practically unusable. Strategically important as a driver of user growth. Reduced page size by 80% resulting in 4x reduction in latency, 50% increase in pageviews and XX% increase in Ads revenue. 
- Search Results Page Latency: Lead an org. wide effort across multiple teams to reduce search latency by XX% over a year. Set quarterly latency goals for Search, provided regular updates to executives, prepared slides for board of directors and spoke at the company all hands. 
- WebP: Started the team and created an open source image format to compress 30% smaller images in lossless and lossy formats. WebP is used to serve Youtube video thumbnails, Android Play Store App icons, Chrome data compression proxy, images on Facebook, Ebay, etc. 
- Page Speed Service: Setup the team and launched a smart Content Distribution Network. Speeded up web pages by 50% by applying web performance best practices and serving through Google’s production infrastructure. 
 Engineering Manager - Infrastructure Projects Google Inc. September 2007  –  May 2010  (2 years 9 months) Mountain View, CA Built and consolidated a number of infrastructure teams that served hundreds of internal developers and hundreds of millions of end users on Search, Youtube, GMail, Calendar, Slides, Spreadsheets, Maps, Chrome, News, Picasa, Google+, etc. 
 
- Closure Tools: JavaScript tools and libraries that enabled the AJAX development model and dominance of JS apps on the desktop web - such as GMail, Maps, Calendar, etc. Closure Compiler is a source to source JS compiler to optimize size, runtime performance and catch errors early. Closure Library is a cross-browser JS library of reusable UI widgets/controls and low level utilities for the DOM, server communication, animation, data structures, unit testing, rich-text editing, etc. Closure Templates is a client and server side templating system for HTML. 
- Client Side Instrumentation is the Google wide infrastructure to gather end user latency metrics from all products. 
- Gadgets are an extension model for combining 3rd party Apps within Google web sites. They improve user engagement by allowing customization & support for the long tail of features. Served 1 billion gadgets/day and created an industry with $100s of millions in revenue for developers. 
- Marketplace service for users to discover web Apps on Chrome App Store, iGoogle, GMail, etc. 
- Enterprise Marketplace for enterprise users to discover extensions to Google Apps. Provided capability for publishing Apps, installation, domain wide configuration, billing and licensing. 
- One Google: A framework for sharing consistent UI elements across Google properties. Most visible UI is the cross-property navigational links on nearly all Google properties. 
- Lightweight browser based rich text editing control embedded into GMail, Google Docs, Blogger, etc. 
 Sr. Engineering Manager - Messenger Yahoo! Inc. May 2000  –  September 2007  (7 years 5 months) Messenger: 
- Established a team of 15 engineers for the rich media effort. Oversaw the client, server & ops teams bringing in annualized direct revenues of over $30 million. Formulated the direction and vision for the engineering team, to align with product & overall company goals. Incorporated engineering processes to scale the team & ensure quality. 
- Developed a real time rich media (voice & video) platform for multiple OS. Featured high quality pc-pc calling over SIP, PSTN In/Out, Video - H264, H263, music sharing, karaoke. 
 
Messenger Enterprise Edition: 
- Built the client team by hiring and training engineers in US & India offices, and subsequently transitioned the team. Featured - end to end encryption (over SSL), admin configuration, portal based authentication, etc. 
 
Webcam: 
- Architected and implemented entire client and server for scalable webcam service on heterogeneous networks from scratch - for Messenger, Chat & Geocities. 
- Brought in direct ad revenues of $5 million in the first 18 months. 23+ million monthly unique users in 175 countries were using webcam for over 5 billion minutes per month. Dozens of press articles and reviews praised Yahoo! to be the first to integrate webcam functionality into messenger to fight AOL’s Instant Messenger and MSN Messenger.

I enjoyed working with him and was impressed by his passion for... View Sr. Software Engineer Mindmaker, Inc. September 1996  –  May 2000  (3 years 9 months) San Jose, CA Natural Language Processing: Defined and implemented SDKs for Natural Language based query refinement, classification and spell checking. Built a compiler to process WordNet crawled data & generate token based lexicons. 
 
Artificial Intelligence: Defined and implemented Radial Basis Function based Neural Networks API. Developed graphical applications illustrating use of API for gaming, speech and gesture/handwriting recognition. Developed Eliza like animated character with text to speech and voice recognition. 
 
Internet applications: Developed a voice recognition based app that reads emails from POP3 and MAPI mailboxes. Developed a real time graphics intensive stock tracking application with voice recognition & text to speech. (Open) 1 recommendation Timothy Musgrove, PhD Founder/CEO at Temnos Of the numerous engineers at Mindmaker, Ramkumar was one of the most reliable and capable. He handled some of the most complex work that we did. Yahoo was one of our customers at the time, and they ended up hiring Ramkumar on the enthusiastic... Summary Andrew recently moved to YouTube team to lead a new stealth project at YouTube after spending 5 years on building a platform for TV industry.  
 
During those 5 years, Andrew was a key member of Google TV team, built 40+ people team in Seoul office while his 4 years of assignment, worked on building a strategy for TV industry / living room, and executing on turning it into a reality, later in Oct 2013, he joined Android Platform team to transform Android to be a suitable OS for TV, STBs, and finally launched it on Nov 3, 2014. 
 
Andrew initially joined Google in 2006 as a founding member of TV ads team, and worked on other TV related efforts and SaaS project at Google until taking on an expatriate assignment in Seoul Korea to build Google TV team there. 
 
Prior to joining Google, Andrew had been in the Cable TV industry for 5 years, and was one of the recognized technical leader in the industry. He demonstrated entrepreneurship via successfully proposing, building and released a VOD (Video On Demand) service on Digeo's award winning MOXI software platform from scratch. 
 
Prior to joining Digeo, Andrew played a key role in iBEAM Broadcasting, a startup in Sunnyvale CA on designing and implementing industry's first global satellite based streaming media distribution system. 
 
Prior to joining iBEAM, Andrew worked on variety of projects including network gaming server, OLTP system integration project, and word processor similar to word-perfect via two companies he founded back in Korea. Experience Engineering Manager III, YouTube Google October 2014  – Present (10 months) Mountain View / San Bruno After spending 5 years on building platform for device makers through Google TV and finally launching Android TV platform with lollipop, Andrew took on a new journey at YouTube. 
Starting a new stealth project at YouTube to bring magical experience to users. Engineering Manager III, Android Platform Google October 2013  –  October 2014  (1 year 1 month) Mountain View, CA As a result of consolidating TV related effort at Google, Andrew and his team joined Android platform team in 2013, has been spearheading an effort to extend Android platform to make it a suitable OS for TV set, STBs for living room. After about a year of hard work, Android TV platform has been created and launched with Nexus Player on Nov 3, 2014. More ATV devices are scheduled to launch in 2015 including actual TV devices from Sony/Sharp/Philips. Head of Google TV engineering, APAC Google March 2010  –  October 2013  (3 years 8 months) Gangnam-gu, Seoul, Korea / Mountain View, CA Andrew has grown Google TV engineering team in Seoul while he's been on assignment for 4 years , completely took over platform engineering and some of the key application/services for TV, and moved back to Google Headquarter in Mountain View, California in June 2013 
 
During his assignment, he achieved followings: 
- Google TV migration to latest version of Android 
- Google TV V1, V2, V3 launches with various OEM partners in US and 10 countries in the world 
- Google TV STB launches with LG U+ (Korean IPTV provider), SFR, Bougyous (French IPTV operartors) and TPV / Philips. 
 
During this time, he changes his role at Google as staff software engineer to a head of engineering group managing 40+ people group including engineers, testers, contractors and temps. 
 
He worked with with Tier 1 companies in TV industry (OEMs, SOC partners, System integrators), and played a role of senior engineering representative of Google TV team, and influenced partners to build a strategy aligned with Google. Staff Software Engineer Google July 2006  –  June 2009  (3 years) Kirkland, WA / Seoul, Korea Andrew joined Google Inc as a founding member of TV ads team, and then moved on to Google's other TV related projects. About a year later, he founded a project which handles billing and payment for SaaS (Software as a service) products at Google and successfully launched it for Google AppEngine, Google Voice, Google Apps Premier edition, Google storage and etc. 
 
In June 2009, he got an expatriate assignment to Google's Seoul R&D center and initiated a few impactful projects targeting mobile industry. One of which became global project (http://goo.gl/yqs0L) launched in 440 cities in the world. After that, in 2010, Andrew joined back to TV related project at Google, a.k.a Google TV, and built a platform engineering group in Seoul (Open) 1 project Google TV Google's effort on building a open platform for living room device (TV, STBs, BDP,...) and to bring Google services on it. It also aims to develop an ecosystem for living room device via open APIs, both Android and Web.
